zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Send_a_scheduled_message
zoho.description: Use this API to schedule a message for delivery at a future date and time.

CHAT_ID.description: The ID of the chat in which the message needs to be scheduled.

body.description: Request body for scheduling a message. `text` is mandatory. Either `schedule_time` or `schedule_status` must be provided. `schedule_timezone` is optional.

schedule_timezone.description: Timezone of the scheduled time (IANA time zone name). Example: Asia/Kolkata

schedule_time.description: The scheduled execution time of the message in ISO 8601 basic format (yyyyMMddTHHmmss). Format details: - yyyyMMdd - 2025-02-11 (Year:2025, Month:02, Day:11) - T - Separator indicating the start of the time component - HHmmss - 09:00:00 (Hour:09, Minute:00, Second:00)

schedule_status.description: Alternative to `schedule_time`. Schedule the message based on user or system events. Allowed values: check_in | user_available | call_end | check_out

text.description: The text to be sent as a scheduled message. Maximum length: 4096 characters.

schedule_timezone.description: Timezone of the scheduled time (IANA time zone name). Example: Asia/Kolkata
schedule_timezone.title: Schedule Timezone

schedule_time.description: The scheduled execution time of the message in ISO 8601 basic format (yyyyMMddTHHmmss). Format details: - yyyyMMdd - 2025-02-11 (Year:2025, Month:02, Day:11) - T - Separator indicating the start of the time component - HHmmss - 09:00:00 (Hour:09, Minute:00, Second:00)
schedule_time.title: Schedule Time

schedule_status.description: Alternative to `schedule_time`. Schedule the message based on user or system events. Allowed values: check_in | user_available | call_end | check_out
schedule_status.title: Schedule Status

text.description: The text to be sent as a scheduled message. Maximum length: 4096 characters.
text.title: Text

CHAT_ID.description: The ID of the chat in which the message needs to be scheduled.
CHAT_ID.title: Chat Id

body.description: Request body for scheduling a message. `text` is mandatory. Either `schedule_time` or `schedule_status` must be provided. `schedule_timezone` is optional.

zoho.name: ZohoMail_sendEmail
zoho.description: This API is used to send an email.

accountId.description: This key is used to identify the account from which the folders have to be fetched. It is generated during account addition.

scheduleTime.description: Specify the date and time you want to schedule your email. This parameter is mandatory if scheduleType is set to value 6. Format:- MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM:SS. For example:- 09/15/2023 14:30:28

attachmentName.description: Specifies the name of the attachment. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.

storeName.description: Specifies the name of the store where the attachment is saved. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.

attachmentPath.description: Specifies the path in which the attachment is stored. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.

subject.description: Provide the subject of the email.

timeZone.description: Specify the timezone to schedule your email. This parameter is mandatory if scheduleType is set to value 6. For example:- GMT 5.30 (India Standard Time - Asia/Calcutta).

bccAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address for the Bcc field. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the Bcc field.

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding that is to be used in the email content. Allowed values:- Big5, EUC-JP, EUC-KR, GB2312, ISO-2022-JP, ISO-8859-1, KOI8-R, Shift_JIS, US-ASCII, UTF-8, WINDOWS-1251, X-WINDOWS-ISO2022JP. The default value is UTF-8.

toAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the To field.

content.description: Provide the content of the email.

ccAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address for the Cc field. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the Cc field.

scheduleType.description: Specifies the type of scheduling. Allowed values:- 1 - Schedules email to be sent after one hour from the time of the request. 2 - Schedules email to be sent after two hours from the time of the request. 3 - Schedules email to be sent after four hours from the time of the request. 4 - Schedules email to be sent by the morning of the next day from the time of the request. 5 - Schedules email to be sent by the afternoon of the next day from the time of the request. 6 - Schedules email to be sent on the custom date and time of your choice.

askReceipt.description: Specifies whether Read receipt from the recipient is requested or not. Allowed values:- yes - Requesting a read receipt. no - Not requesting a read receipt

fromAddress.description: Provide the sender's email address (associated to the authenticated account). Allowed values:- Valid email address corresponding to the authenticated account for the From field.

mailFormat.description: Specify the format in which the mail needs to be sent. The value can be html or plaintext. The default value is html.

isSchedule.description: Depending on whether the mail has to be scheduled or not, the value can be true - if the email should be scheduled. false - if the email should be sent immediately.

scheduleTime.description: Specify the date and time you want to schedule your email. This parameter is mandatory if scheduleType is set to value 6. Format:- MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM:SS. For example:- 09/15/2023 14:30:28
scheduleTime.title: Scheduletime

subject.description: Provide the subject of the email.
subject.title: Subject

timeZone.description: Specify the timezone to schedule your email. This parameter is mandatory if scheduleType is set to value 6. For example:- GMT 5.30 (India Standard Time - Asia/Calcutta).
timeZone.title: Timezone

bccAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address for the Bcc field. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the Bcc field.
bccAddress.title: Bccaddress

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding that is to be used in the email content. Allowed values:- Big5, EUC-JP, EUC-KR, GB2312, ISO-2022-JP, ISO-8859-1, KOI8-R, Shift_JIS, US-ASCII, UTF-8, WINDOWS-1251, X-WINDOWS-ISO2022JP. The default value is UTF-8.
encoding.title: Encoding

toAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the To field.
toAddress.title: Toaddress

content.description: Provide the content of the email.
content.title: Content

ccAddress.description: Provide the recipient's email address for the Cc field. Allowed values:- Valid recipient email address for the Cc field.
ccAddress.title: Ccaddress

scheduleType.description: Specifies the type of scheduling. Allowed values:- 1 - Schedules email to be sent after one hour from the time of the request. 2 - Schedules email to be sent after two hours from the time of the request. 3 - Schedules email to be sent after four hours from the time of the request. 4 - Schedules email to be sent by the morning of the next day from the time of the request. 5 - Schedules email to be sent by the afternoon of the next day from the time of the request. 6 - Schedules email to be sent on the custom date and time of your choice.
scheduleType.title: Scheduletype

askReceipt.description: Specifies whether Read receipt from the recipient is requested or not. Allowed values:- yes - Requesting a read receipt. no - Not requesting a read receipt
askReceipt.title: Askreceipt

fromAddress.description: Provide the sender's email address (associated to the authenticated account). Allowed values:- Valid email address corresponding to the authenticated account for the From field.
fromAddress.title: Fromaddress

mailFormat.description: Specify the format in which the mail needs to be sent. The value can be html or plaintext. The default value is html.
mailFormat.title: Mailformat

isSchedule.description: Depending on whether the mail has to be scheduled or not, the value can be true - if the email should be scheduled. false - if the email should be sent immediately.
isSchedule.title: Isschedule

attachmentName.description: Specifies the name of the attachment. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.
attachmentName.title: Attachmentname

storeName.description: Specifies the name of the store where the attachment is saved. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.
storeName.title: Storename

attachmentPath.description: Specifies the path in which the attachment is stored. This parameter can be fetched from Upload Attachments API.
attachmentPath.title: Attachmentpath

accountId.description: This key is used to identify the account from which the folders have to be fetched. It is generated during account addition.
accountId.title: Accountid

recurrence_id.description: To retrieve the details of a specific occurrence of a recurring event.

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Get_Events
zoho.description: Use this API to get the list of all your events scheduled within the next 31 days.

search.description: A keyword or phrase used to filter events based on search text. Matches are performed on the titles of events.

from.description: The start of the time interval from when you want to retrieve the events. From time should be passed in milliseconds.

include_hidden_calendars.description: Choose whether to display events from hidden calendars or not.

ignore_declined_events.description: Choose whether to ignore declined events or not.

to.description: The end of the time interval from when you want to retrieve the events. To time should be passed in milliseconds.

include_disabled_calendar.description: Choose whether to display events from disabled calendars or not.

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Get_Participants_of_a_call_or_meeting
zoho.description:
Use this API to get all the participants in a call or a meeting
The header X-API-VERSION 1 must be passed to support the use of query params. Users can get the call ID from the nrs_id key in the AV_History API.

filter.description:
Use this parameter to fetch the list of active and inactive users in the call.
Allowed values:
  - live: Current live users
  - invited: Users invited but yet to join
  - joined: Users who joined and left the call

limit.description: Use this parameter to specifiy the number of participants retrieved per API call.

from.description: Use this parameter to fetch participants from the specified time.

to.description: Use this parameter to fetch participants till the specified time.

next_token.description: Token to get the next set of participants.

filter.description:
Use this parameter to fetch the list of active and inactive users in the call.
Allowed values:
  - live: Current live users
  - invited: Users invited but yet to join
  - joined: Users who joined and left the call
filter.title: Filter

limit.description: Use this parameter to specifiy the number of participants retrieved per API call.
limit.title: Limit

from.description: Use this parameter to fetch participants from the specified time.
from.title: From

to.description: Use this parameter to fetch participants till the specified time.
to.title: To

next_token.description: Token to get the next set of participants.
next_token.title: Next Token

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Get_the_list_of_all_reminders
zoho.description:
Use this API to retrieve details for all reminders. If no specific category is indicated, the API will return a list of reminders under the default category "mine." By default, the API provides a list of 20 reminders.
next_set_token: This token will be issued in two scenarios:
  If no limit is specified and there are more than 20 reminders in your list.
  If you set a limit on the number of reminders to be retrieved, the token will be provided to access the next set of reminders. Please note that the token will be given only if the total number of reminders exceeds the limit you specified.

next_set_token.description: Specify this token to fetch the next set of reminders.

limit.description: Specify the number of reminders to be retrieved.

category.description:
Retrieves reminders from the specified category.

mine: Active reminders assigned to or created by the user (default).
mine-completed: Completed reminders assigned to or created by the user.
others: Active reminders created by the user for others (users or chats).
others-completed: Completed reminders created by the user for others.

next_set_token.description: Specify this token to fetch the next set of reminders.
next_set_token.title: Next Set Token

limit.description: Specify the number of reminders to be retrieved.
limit.title: Limit

category.description:
Retrieves reminders from the specified category.

mine: Active reminders assigned to or created by the user (default).
mine-completed: Completed reminders assigned to or created by the user.
others: Active reminders created by the user for others (users or chats).
others-completed: Completed reminders created by the user for others.
category.title: Category

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Get_threads_of_a_channel
zoho.description: Use this API to retrieve all the threads in a chat.

state.description:
Determines the follow status of the threads to be retrieved.
Allowed values:
followed - Returns only the threads the user is following. not_followed - Returns only the threads the user is not following. all - Returns all threads, regardless of follow status.
If the state parameter is not specified, the default value will be all.

type.description:
Filters threads based on their current status.
Allowed values:
open - Returns threads that are currently active or ongoing. closed - Returns threads that have been marked as closed or resolved.
If a type parameter is not specified, all threads in the parent chat will be returned.

CHANNEL_ID.description: Channel ID from which the threads need to be retrieved.

body.description: Request parameters to retrieve threads from a channel.

limit.description: Maximum number of threads to return in the response.

next_token.description: Used for pagination. Pass the next_token received in the previous API response to get the next page.

limit.description: Maximum number of threads to return in the response.
limit.title: Limit

next_token.description: Used for pagination. Pass the next_token received in the previous API response to get the next page.
next_token.title: Next Token

CHANNEL_ID.description: Channel ID from which the threads need to be retrieved.
CHANNEL_ID.title: Channel Id

state.description:
Determines the follow status of the threads to be retrieved.
Allowed values:
followed - Returns only the threads the user is following. not_followed - Returns only the threads the user is not following. all - Returns all threads, regardless of follow status.
If the state parameter is not specified, the default value will be all.
state.title: State

type.description:
Filters threads based on their current status.
Allowed values:
open - Returns threads that are currently active or ongoing. closed - Returns threads that have been marked as closed or resolved.
If a type parameter is not specified, all threads in the parent chat will be returned.
type.title: Type

body.description: Request parameters to retrieve threads from a channel.

zoho.description: Use  this API to fetch the list of teams that the user belongs to. Head on over here to know more about team object attributes.

User ID.description: Unique identifier of the user whose team information need to be retrieved.
Unique identifier of the user whose team information need to be retrieved.
User ID.title: User Id

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_List_all_channels
zoho.description: Retrieve a list of channels based on the given filters.

channel_ids.description: The list of channel IDs for which details have to be retrieved. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.

chat_ids.description: Unique channel chat IDs for which details have to be retrieved. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.

pinned.description:
When pinned = true, only pinned channels are retrieved.  
When pinned = false, all channels are retrieved regardless of pin status.

created_after.description: The list of channels created after the specified time.

level.description:
Specifies the level to fetch channels of a particular type.
Allowed values:
  - organization: Public channel visible to everyone in the organization.
  - team: Channel visible only to specific teams.
  - private: Invitation-only channel with restricted access.
  - external: Channel with participants outside the organization.

team_ids.description: Gets the list of channels associated with the specified team IDs. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.

sync_token.description:
Gets the list of recently updated channels after which the previous request was made.  
Note: The sync_token will return an exception if the number of channels to be synced is greater than 50.

joined.description:
When joined = true, only the joined channels are fetched.  
When joined = false, only the non-joined channels are fetched.  
When not specified, all types of channels will be returned.

modified_after.description: Gets the list of channels where the last message is sent after the mentioned time.

next_token.description: Use this parameter to fetch the next immediate list of channels.

created_by.description: Gets the list of channels created by the mentioned email ID or user ID.

created_before.description: The list of channels created before the specified time.

modified_before.description: Gets the list of channels where the last message is sent before the mentioned time.

name.description: Name of the channel to be retrieved.

limit.description: The number of channels that has to be retrieved. Maximum limit will be 100.

order_by.description:
To sort the list of available channels in either ascending or descending order.
Allowed values:
  - +last_modified_time: Sort channels by last modified time in ascending order.
  - -last_modified_time: Sort channels by last modified time in descending order.
  - +creation_time: Sort channels by creation time in ascending order.
  - -creation_time: Sort channels by creation time in descending order.

status.description:
Status of the channel to be retrieved.
Allowed values:
  - created: Channels that are active and fully created.
  - pending: Channels that are in the process of being created or awaiting confirmation.
  - archived: Channels that are no longer active and have been archived.

channel_ids.description: The list of channel IDs for which details have to be retrieved. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.
channel_ids.title: Channel Ids

chat_ids.description: Unique channel chat IDs for which details have to be retrieved. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.
chat_ids.title: Chat Ids

pinned.description:
When pinned = true, only pinned channels are retrieved.  
When pinned = false, all channels are retrieved regardless of pin status.
pinned.title: Pinned

created_after.description: The list of channels created after the specified time.
created_after.title: Created After

level.description:
Specifies the level to fetch channels of a particular type.
Allowed values:
  - organization: Public channel visible to everyone in the organization.
  - team: Channel visible only to specific teams.
  - private: Invitation-only channel with restricted access.
  - external: Channel with participants outside the organization.
level.title: Level

team_ids.description: Gets the list of channels associated with the specified team IDs. You can enter multiple fields separated by commas.
team_ids.title: Team Ids

sync_token.description:
Gets the list of recently updated channels after which the previous request was made.  
Note: The sync_token will return an exception if the number of channels to be synced is greater than 50.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

joined.description:
When joined = true, only the joined channels are fetched.  
When joined = false, only the non-joined channels are fetched.  
When not specified, all types of channels will be returned.
joined.title: Joined

modified_after.description: Gets the list of channels where the last message is sent after the mentioned time.
modified_after.title: Modified After

next_token.description: Use this parameter to fetch the next immediate list of channels.
next_token.title: Next Token

created_by.description: Gets the list of channels created by the mentioned email ID or user ID.
created_by.title: Created By

created_before.description: The list of channels created before the specified time.
created_before.title: Created Before

modified_before.description: Gets the list of channels where the last message is sent before the mentioned time.
modified_before.title: Modified Before

name.description: Name of the channel to be retrieved.
name.title: Name

limit.description: The number of channels that has to be retrieved. Maximum limit will be 100.
limit.title: Limit

order_by.description:
To sort the list of available channels in either ascending or descending order.
Allowed values:
  - +last_modified_time: Sort channels by last modified time in ascending order.
  - -last_modified_time: Sort channels by last modified time in descending order.
  - +creation_time: Sort channels by creation time in ascending order.
  - -creation_time: Sort channels by creation time in descending order.
order_by.title: Order By

status.description:
Status of the channel to be retrieved.
Allowed values:
  - created: Channels that are active and fully created.
  - pending: Channels that are in the process of being created or awaiting confirmation.
  - archived: Channels that are no longer active and have been archived.
status.title: Status

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_List_all_Teams
zoho.description: Use this to get the list of all teams.

joined.description: If joined = true, then the response contains the list of teams containing the user as a member.
If joined = true, then the response contains the list of teams containing the user as a member.
joined.title: Joined

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_List_records
zoho.description: Use this API to get the list of all records in a specific database.

from_index.description: This parameter fetches records starting from a particular index value.

start_token.description: This token is obtained in the response JSON when from_index and limit are specified. Use this parameter in the next request to retrieve the remaining records in the database.

criteria.description: This parameter fetches records that meet the specified criteria expression.

limit.description: Use this parameter to limit the number of records fetched from a particular index value.

order_by.description:
Use this parameter to retrieve the list of records in ascending or descending order. Allowed values:

  +column_name - Ascending order by the specified column.
  -column_name - Descending order by the specified column.

Note: Use %2B instead of + in URLs, as + is a reserved character.

DATABASE_UNIQUE_NAME.description: The unique name of the database in which you'd like to fetch the records.
The unique name of the database in which you'd like to fetch the records.
DATABASE_UNIQUE_NAME.title: Database Unique Name

from_index.description: This parameter fetches records starting from a particular index value.
from_index.title: From Index

start_token.description: This token is obtained in the response JSON when from_index and limit are specified. Use this parameter in the next request to retrieve the remaining records in the database.
start_token.title: Start Token

criteria.description: This parameter fetches records that meet the specified criteria expression.
criteria.title: Criteria

limit.description: Use this parameter to limit the number of records fetched from a particular index value.
limit.title: Limit

order_by.description:
Use this parameter to retrieve the list of records in ascending or descending order. Allowed values:

  +column_name - Ascending order by the specified column.
  -column_name - Descending order by the specified column.

Note: Use %2B instead of + in URLs, as + is a reserved character.
order_by.title: Order By

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Retrieve_role_details

PROFILE_ID.description: Unique identifier of the role to be retrieved.

zoho.name: ZohoCliq_Update_user_details
zoho.description: Use this API to edit or update a user's details.

User ID.description: Unique identifier of the user whose details needs to be updated.

body.description: Request body to create or update one or more users.

users.description: Array of user objects to be created or updated.

items.description: User object to be created or updated

email_id.description: The email ID of the user. (Mandatory)

channel_ids.description: IDs of the channels the user will be added to.

department_id.description: ID of the department where the user will be added.

team_ids.description: IDs of the teams the user will be added to.

designation_id.description: ID of the designation to be associated with the user.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

display_name.description: The display name of the user.

image_data.description: The profile picture of the user in Base64 format.

Custom_Field_UniqueName.description:
Unique name of a custom user field.  
- Note: This is not a static value and can change according to the user-defined field name.  
- Example: For a custom user field "Workplace Name", provide its unique name `workplace_name`.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

reporting_to_zuid.description: User ID of the reporting manager.
